member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.ConstructorAttribute
member.summary: When this attribute is placed on a field, such field is filled with the newly constructed object of a same type as field. To construct such object, the parameters given in a attribute are used.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ConstructorAttribute.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes attribute with given parameters which will be later passed to the constructor.
member.param: Parameters.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.ConstructorAttribute.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters passed to the attribute.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Consts
member.summary: Contains universal constants used by the serializer.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Consts.NullObjectId
member.summary: When used in a place where type id or object id is expected, it indicates the null reference.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.ISpeciallySerializable
member.summary: When implemented, its method are used by serializer to save or load the state of the object. Implementing class must contain a parameterless constructor which is invoked during deserialization, immediately before calling the method.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ISpeciallySerializable.Load(Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader)
member.summary: Invoked by the serializer immediately after construction of object (using parameterless constructor). Should restore the state of the object, previously stored using the method.
member.param: The reader which should be used to read the previously written data.
member.remarks: This method must read the number of bytes that were earlier written. Otherwise the is thrown.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ISpeciallySerializable.Save(Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter)
member.summary: Invoked by the serializer during serialization. Should store the state of the object which can be later read using the method.
member.param: Writer used to save the state of the object.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier
member.summary: Gives consecutive, unique identifiers for presented objects during its lifetime. Can also be used to retrive an object by its ID.
member.remarks: The first returned id is 0. For given object, if it was presented to the class earlier, the previously returned identificator is returned again. Note that the objects presented to class are remembered, so they will not be collected until the ObjectIdentifier lives.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.#ctor(Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifierContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, reusing given context.
member.param: Context to reuse.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.GetContext
member.summary: Gets the context of object identifier that can be used for open stream serialization.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.GetId(System.Object,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: For a given object, returns its unique ID. The new ID is used if object was not presented to this class earlier, otherwise the previously returned is used.
member.param: An object to give unique ID for.
Out parameter specifying if returned id has just been generated.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.GetId(System.Object)
member.summary: For a given object, returns its unique ID. The new ID is used if object was not presented to this class earlier, otherwise the previously returned is used.
member.param: An object to give unique ID for.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.SetIdentifierForObject(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets new identifier for object.
REMARK: Setting new mapping of object to id does not remove the old one. As a reuslt, after this operation asking for id of old object and new object results in returing the same identifier. This behaviour is intended to support surrogated objects.
member.param: Object
Identifier

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.GetObject(System.Int32)
member.summary: For an ID which was previously returned by the method, returns an object for which this ID was generated.
member.returns: The object for which given ID was returned.
member.param: The unique ID, previously returned by the method.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: For an ID which was previously returned by the method, returns an object for which this ID was generated.
member.param: The unique ID, previously returned by the method.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.Count
member.summary: Gets the count of the unique objects presented to class. It is also the first unoccupied ID which will be returned for the new object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifier.Clear
member.summary: Clears internal elements.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectReader.ReadObjectInnerUsingReflection(Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectReader,System.Type,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Reads the object using reflection.
REMARK: this method is not thread-safe
member.param: Object reader
Type of object to deserialize
Identifier of object to deserialize

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectWriter.WriteObjectUsingReflection(Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectWriter,System.Object)
member.summary:
Writes the object using reflection.
REMARK: this method is not thread-safe!
member.param: Object writer's object
Object to serialize

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader
member.summary: Provides the mechanism for reading primitive values from a stream.
member.remarks: Can be used as a replacement for the . Provides more compact output and reads no more data from the stream than requested. Although the underlying format is not specified at this point, it is guaranteed to be consistent with . Reader has to be disposed after used, otherwise stream position corruption can occur. Reader does not possess the stream and does not close it after dispose.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The underlying stream which will be used to read data. Has to be readable.

True if reads should assume that corresponding PrimitiveWriter used buffering. False otherwise, then no read prefetching or padding is used. Note that corresponding PrimitiveWriter always have to have the same value for this parameter.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position.
member.value: The position, which is the number of bytes read after this object was constructed.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.IsBuffered
member.summary: Gets current buffering configuration.
member.value: true if this the data read from stream is buffered; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Reads the .

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes.
member.param: Number of bytes to read.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.CopyTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Copies given number of bytes to a given stream.
member.param: Writeable stream to which data will be copied.
The number of bytes which will be copied to the destination stream.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveReader.Dispose
member.summary: After this call stream's position is updated to match the padding used by . It is needed to be called if one expects consecutive reads (of data written previously by consecutive writes). It is not necessary to call this method when buffering is not used.
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter
member.summary: Provides the mechanism for writing primitive values into a stream.
member.remarks: Can be used as a replacement for the . Provides more compact output and reads no more data from the stream than requested. Although the underlying format is not specified at this point, it is guaranteed to be consistent with . Writer has to be disposed after used, otherwise stream position corruption and data loss can occur. Writer does not possess the stream and does not close it after dispose.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The underlying stream which will be used to write data. Has to be writeable.

True if writes should be buffered, false when they should be immediately passed to the stream. With false also no final padding is used. Note that corresponding PrimitiveReader has to use the same value for this parameter.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position.
member.value: The position, which is the number of bytes written after this object was constructed.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.IsBuffered
member.summary: Gets current buffering configuration.
member.value: true if this the data written to stream is buffered; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.Write(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes the specified value of type .

member.summary: Writes the specified value of type .

member.summary: Writes the specified value of type .

member.summary: Writes the specified bytes array.

member.summary: Write the specified bytes array, starting at offset and writing count from it.
member.param: The array which is a source to write.
Index of the array to start writing at.
Total bytes to write.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.CopyFrom(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Copies given number of bytes from the source stream to the underlying stream.
member.param: Readable stream, from which data will be copied.
The amount of a data to copy in bytes.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.PrimitiveWriter.Dispose
member.summary: Flushes the buffer and pads the stream with sufficient amount of data to be compatible with the . It is not necessary to call this method when buffering is not used.
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer
member.summary: Provides the mechanism for binary serialization and deserialization of objects.
member.remarks: Please consult the general serializer documentation to find the limitations and constraints which serialized objects must fullfill.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.#ctor(Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Serializer's settings, can be null or not given, in that case default settings are used.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.Serialize(System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Serializes the specified object to a given stream.
member.param: Object to serialize along with its references.
Stream to which the given object should be serialized. Has to be writeable.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObtainOpenStreamSerializer(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns the open stream serializer, which can be used to do consecutive serializations
member.param: Stream.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObtainOpenStreamDeserializer(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns the open stream serializer, which can be used to do consecutive deserializations when same technique was used to serialize data.
member.param: Stream.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ForSurrogate``1
member.summary: Gives the ability to set callback providing object for surrogate of given type. The object will be provided instead of such surrogate in the effect of deserialization.
member.returns: Object letting you set the object for the given surrogate type.
member.typeparam: The type for which callback will be invoked.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ForSurrogate(System.Type)
member.summary: Gives the ability to set callback providing object for surrogate of given type. The object will be provided instead of such surrogate in the effect of deserialization.
member.returns: Object letting you set the object for the given surrogate type.
member.param: The type for which callback will be invoked.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ForObject``1
member.summary: Gives the ability to set callback providing surrogate for objects of given type. The surrogate will be serialized instead of the object of that type.
member.returns: Object letting you set the surrogate for the given type.
member.typeparam: The type for which callback will be invoked.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ForObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Gives the ability to set callback providing surrogate for objects of given type. The surrogate will be serialized instead of the object of that type.
member.returns: Object letting you set the surrogate for the given type.
member.param: The type for which callback will be invoked.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.Deserialize``1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Deserializes object from the specified stream.
member.param: The stream to read data from. Must be readable.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the deserialized object. The deserialized object must be convertible to this type.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.TryDeserialize``1(System.IO.Stream,``0@)
member.summary: Tries to deserialize object from specified stream.
member.param: The stream to read data from. Must be readable.
Deserialized object.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the deserialized object. The deserialized object must be convertible to this type.

member.name: E:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OnPreSerialization
member.summary: Is invoked before serialization, once for every unique, serialized object. Provides this object in its single parameter.

member.name: E:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OnPostSerialization
member.summary: Is invoked after serialization, once for every unique, serialized object. Provides this object in its single parameter.

member.name: E:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OnPostDeserialization
member.summary: Is invoked before deserialization, once for every unique, serialized object. Provides this object in its single parameter.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.DeepClone``1(``0,Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings)
member.summary: Makes a deep copy of a given object using the serializer.
member.returns: The deep copy of a given object.
member.param: The object to make a deep copy of.
Settings used for serializer which does deep clone.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.BaseObjectForSurrogateSetter
member.summary: Base class for surrogate setter.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObjectForSurrogateSetter`1
member.summary: Lets you set a callback providing object for type of the surrogate given to method that provided this object on a serializer that provided this object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObjectForSurrogateSetter`1.SetObject``1(System.Func{`0,``0})
member.summary: Sets the callback proividing object for surrogate.
member.param: Callback proividing object for surrogate. The callback can be null, in that case surrogate of the type will be deserialized as is even if there is an object for the more general type.
member.typeparam: The type of the object returned by callback.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObjectForSurrogateSetter
member.summary: Lets you set a callback providing object for type of the surrogate given to method that provided this object on a serializer that provided this object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.ObjectForSurrogateSetter.SetObject(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the callback proividing object for surrogate.
member.param: Callback proividing object for surrogate. The callback can be null, in that case surrogate of the appropriate type will be deserialized as is even if there is an object for the more general type.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.BaseSurrogateForObjectSetter
member.summary: Base class for object setter.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.SurrogateForObjectSetter`1
member.summary: Lets you set a callback providing surrogate for type of the object given to method that provided this object on a serializer that provided this object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.SurrogateForObjectSetter`1.SetSurrogate``1(System.Func{`0,``0})
member.summary: Sets the callback providing surrogate for object.
member.param: Callback providing surrogate for object. The callback can be null, in that case object of the type will be serialized as is even if there is a surrogate for the more general type.
member.typeparam: The type of the object returned by callback.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.SurrogateForObjectSetter
member.summary: Lets you set a callback providing surrogate for type of the object given to method that provided this object on a serializer that provided this object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.SurrogateForObjectSetter.SetSurrogate(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the callback providing surrogate for object.
member.param: Callback providing surrogate for object. The callback can be null, in that case object of the appropriate type will be serialized as is even if there is a surrogate for the more general type.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.SurrogateForObjectSetter.SetSurrogateGenericType(System.Type)
member.summary:
Sets the generic surrogate type that should be used to replace the original one.
It is required for the type to be generic, has the same amount of parameters as the original one and to has a constructor accepting one parameter of the original type.
member.param: Generic type.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamSerializer
member.summary: Serializer that is attached to one stream and can do consecutive serializations that are aware of the data written by previous ones.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamSerializer.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Serialize the specified object.
member.param: Object.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamSerializer.Dispose
member.summary: Flushes the buffer and necessary padding. Not necessary when buffering is not used.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamDeserializer
member.summary: Deserializer that is attached to one stream and can do consecutive deserializations that are aware of the data written by previous ones.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamDeserializer.Deserialize``1
member.summary: Deserializes next object waiting in the stream.
member.typeparam: The expected formal type of object to deserialize.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamDeserializer.DeserializeMany``1
member.summary: Deserializes objects until end of the stream is reached. All objects have to be castable to T. This method is only available when buffering is disabled.
member.typeparam: The expected type of object to deserialize.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Serializer.OpenStreamDeserializer.Dispose
member.summary: Reads leftover padding. Not necessary if buffering is not used.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.TransientAttribute
member.summary: When used on a class, it prevents the serialization of all fields which have the type of that class. When used on a field, it prevents the serialization of this field.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList
member.summary: Key/value pair list in which more generic types are always inserted after their specializations.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList.AddOrReplace(System.Type,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Adds new key/value pair or replaces existing one if the key already exists.
member.param: Key.
Value.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList.AddGenericTemplate(System.Type,System.Func{System.Type,System.Delegate})
member.summary: Adds new key/dynamically generated pair or replaces one if the key already exists.
member.param: Key.
Function generating final value.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList.GetByIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a delegate by an index.
member.param: The index of the element.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.Utilities.SwapList.FindMatchingIndex(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds the index of the delegate that matches given type.
member.returns: The index of delegate that matches given type or -1 if it could not be found.
member.param: Type to match.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Hooks.PreSerializationAttribute
member.summary: Method decorated with this attribute will be invoked before serialization.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Hooks.LatePostDeserializationAttribute
member.summary: Method decorated with this attribute will be invoked after whole deserialization has been finished in the opposite order they were encountered during deserialization.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Hooks.LatePostSerializationAttribute
member.summary: Method decorated with this attribute will be invoked after the whole serialization has been finished in the opposite order they were encountered during serialization.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Hooks.PostSerializationAttribute
member.summary: Method decorated with this attribute will be invoked after deserialization of given object and all objects referenced by this object.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Hooks.PostDeserializationAttribute
member.summary: Method decorated with this attribute will be invoked after deserialization of given object and all objects referenced by this object.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings
member.summary: Contains serialization settings.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.SerializationMethod
member.summary: Gets the method used for serialization.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.DeserializationMethod
member.summary: Gets the method used for deserialization.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.VersionTolerance
member.summary: Specifies how much the layout of the serialized class can differ from the version that is available when that data is deserialized.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.SupportForISerializable
member.summary: Specifies whether Migrant should use GetObjectData approach for serialization.
member.value: true if support for ISerializable is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.SupportForIXmlSerializable
member.summary: Specifies whether Migrant should utilize IXmlSerializable interface.
member.value: true if support for IXmlSserializable is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.TreatCollectionAsUserObject
member.summary: > Gets the value of flag specifing if collection objects are to be deserialized without optimization (treated as normal user objects).

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.UseBuffering
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether buffering is used. Without buffering, all writes are going directly to underlying and stream and no padding is used. Reads behave accordingly.
member.value: true if buffering is used; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.ReferencePreservation
member.summary: Tells serializer how to treat identity of objects between sessions of open stream serialization.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.DisableTypeStamping
member.summary: Specifies if type stamping should be disabled in order to improve performance and limit output stream size.
member.value: true if disable type stamping; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Settings.ForceStampVerification
member.summary: Specifies if type stamps should be compared even when GUID has not changed. This is used in internal framework's tests.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Method used for serialization.
Method used for deserialization.
Specifies the possible level of difference between class layout when it was serialized and in the moment of deserialization.
Specifies if collection objects are to be deserialized without optimization (treated as normal user objects).
Specifies whether Migrant should use GetObjectData approach for serialization.
Specifies whether Migrant should use xml serialization on objects implementing IXmlSerializable.
True if buffering should be used, false if writes should directly go to the stream and reads should never read data in advance. Disabling buffering also disables padding.
Specifies if type stamping should be disabled in order to improve performance and limit output stream size.
Tells serializer how to treat references between sessions of open stream serialization.
Specifies if type stamps should be compared even when GUID has not changed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Method used for serialization.
Method used for deserialization.
Specifies the possible level of difference between class layout when it was serialized and in the moment of deserialization.
Specifies if collection objects are to be deserialized without optimization (treated as normal user objects).
Specifies whether Migrant should use GetObjectData approach for serialization.
True if buffering should be used, false if writes should directly go to the stream and reads should never read data in advance. Disabling buffering also disables padding.
Specifies if type stamping should be disabled in order to improve performance and limit output stream size.
Tells serializer how to treat references between sessions of open stream serialization.
Specifies if type stamps should be compared even when GUID has not changed.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Method
member.summary: Method of serialization or deserialization.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Method.Generated
member.summary: (De)Serialization is done using write method generator. For any type which encountered for the first time, the methods to serialize it are generated.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.Method.Reflection
member.summary: (De)Serialization is done directly using reflection.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel
member.summary: Level of the version tolerance, that is how much layout of the deserialized type can differ from the (original) layout of the serialized type.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel.AllowGuidChange
member.summary: Difference in guid is allowed which means that classes may be from different compilation of the same library.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel.AllowFieldAddition
member.summary: The new layout can have more fields that the old one. They are initialized to their default values. This flag implies .

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel.AllowFieldRemoval
member.summary: The new layout can have less fields that the old one. Values of the missing one are ignored. This flag implies .

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel.AllowInheritanceChainChange
member.summary: Classes inheritance hirarchy can vary between new and old layout, e.g., base class can be removed. This flag implies .

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.VersionToleranceLevel.AllowAssemblyVersionChange
member.summary: Assemblies version can very between new and old layout. This flag implies .

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.ReferencePreservation
member.summary: Used with open stream serialization and tells serializer how to deal with references between different sessions of serialization.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.ReferencePreservation.DoNotPreserve
member.summary: If the same object is written in a different serialization session, it is written as a newly encountered object.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.ReferencePreservation.Preserve
member.summary: Identity of all objects is preserved between sessions. This option will, however, create a hard reference for each so far serialized object. This means that all objects serialized so for will live until open stream serializer is disposed.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.Customization.ReferencePreservation.UseWeakReference
member.summary: Object identity is preserved without hard references. This option is conceptually the best one, can however vastly influence performance.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.VersionTolerance.VersionToleranceException
member.summary: Class representing exception thrown when version tolerance verification mechanism detects disallowed changes in type structures.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.VersionTolerance.VersionToleranceException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Context.

member.name: M:Antmicro.Migrant.VersionTolerance.VersionToleranceException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Inner exception.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult
member.summary: Enumeration describing possible desarialization operation results.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.OK
member.summary: Deserialization succeeded.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.WrongMagic
member.summary: Magic number was different than expected.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.WrongVersion
member.summary: Serializer version mismatch.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.TypeStructureChanged
member.summary: The type structure has changed in a not allowed way.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.StreamCorrupted
member.summary: Data in a stream was corrupted.

member.name: F:Antmicro.Migrant.DeserializationResult.WrongStreamConfiguration
member.summary: Type stamping configuration is inconsistent between stream and deserializer settings.

member.name: T:Antmicro.Migrant.ObjectIdentifierContext
member.summary: A context of object identifier, i.e. all identified objects (weakly referenced) with their identifiers.
